title: What Joe Biden Has Wrought in Afghanistan
sub_head: The U.S. leaves behind weapons for the Taliban to use as they please or sell, arming Islamic terror around the world.
body:
I was wrong. When President Biden was elected, I thought we finally had a leader who is respected in the world, one with the experience to keep America safe (“Biden’s Afghanistan Surrender,” Review & Outlook, Aug. 16). I also expected him to govern from the center, as he campaigned.
The misadventure in Afghanistan shows that he was more concerned about the political optics of getting the troops out by a certain date than planning a safe withdrawal. His miscalculation, which even I could foresee, could lead to American fatalities and certainly further Afghan suffering and deaths. We may also see a resurgence of Islamic terrorism. It’s so disappointing, tragic and avoidable.
Arthur L. Wisot
Rolling Hills Estates, Calif.
